results.title: Hyper >> [games magazine] Issue 7, June 1994
results.creator_credit: Otter Publishing, Stuart Clarke and Phillip Keir
results.brief_description:
Hyper was a multi-platform Australian video game magazine. It was Australia’s longest running gaming magazine, published from 1993 to 2019.

In addition to coverage of current major video game systems and game releases, Hyper also covered anime, DVD movies, arcade and classic games, and featured interviews with industry professionals and articles on game-related content such as game classifications, computer hardware and video game music. Hyper also had a sister magazine, the PC gaming oriented PC PowerPlay. (citation from Wikipedia).

A digital version of the magazine can be found here: https://archive.org/details/hyper-007

results.title: All the love
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the Spastic Society of Victoria in the care and treatment of the cerebral palsied. Activities are designed to suit individual cases, always with the aim of fitting them for a normal life. Shows a variety of therapeutic treatments, and the organization of workshops within the Centres and under contract to outside companies.

results.title: Dementia: A Community Challenge
results.brief_description: A documentary which examines the problems that five different people have of caring for relations who are at different stages of dementia.

results.title: Cricket Coaching Clinic
results.brief_description: A program in which international cricketers demonstrate the essential skills of the game. “The Cricket Coaching Clinic” is designed to instruct and motivate young and old, the uninitiated and the experienced.
